intro: Tricholepidium chapaense, commonly known as the Chapa's spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its milky sap and often unusual floral structures. The plant typically features simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the spurge family. Tricholepidium chapaense is adapted to grow in dry, rocky environments, showcasing its resilience to arid conditions.
